alert.note: Alert for Benton; Camden; Dent; Maries; Miller; Morgan; Phelps; Pulaski; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 4:44PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MARIES...DENT...EAST CENTRAL BENTON...MILLER...PULASKI...NORTH CENTRAL TEXAS...PHELPS... NORTHEASTERN CAMDEN AND SOUTHERN MORGAN COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM CDT... At 444 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Stover to 12 miles north of Licking. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rolla, northern Fort Leonard Wood, Lake of The Ozarks, Lake of The Ozarks State Park, Salem, Waynesville, Eldon, Osage Beach, St. Robert, St. James, Versailles, Village of Four Seasons, Richland, Lake Ozark, Dixon, Belle, Crocker, Laurie, Iberia and Doolittle. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 154 and 169, and between mile markers 171 and 199. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Camden; Dent; Maries; Miller; Morgan; Phelps; Pulaski; Texas
